original: Execution Copy COLLABORATIVE RESEARCH, DEVELOPMENT AND COMMERCIALIZATION AGREEMENT This COLLABORATIVE RESEARCH, DEVELOPMENT AND COMMERCIALIZATION AGREEMENT (this “ Agreement ”) is entered into as of June 8, 2018 (the “ Execution Date ”), by and between Revolution Medicines, Inc. , a corporation organized and existing under the laws of Delaware, having its principal place of business at 700 Saginaw Dr. Redwood City, CA 94063, USA (“ RevMed ”), and Aventis, Inc., a corporation organized and existing under the laws of Pennsylvania, having offices at 55 Corporate Drive, Bridgewater, NJ 08807 (“ Sanofi ”). Sanofi and RevMed are referred to in this Agreement individually as a “ Party ” and collectively as the “ Parties .” RECITALS WHEREAS, RevMed has developed expertise in cancer biology and related drug discovery and precision medicine capabilities enabling RevMed to design and optimize drug candidates that inhibit the activity of the cancer target known as Src homology region 2-containing  protein tyrosine phosphatase 2; WHEREAS, Sanofi is a pharmaceutical company working to develop and commercialize novel therapies; WHEREAS, RevMed and Sanofi desire to establish a collaboration for the research, development and potential commercialization of such drug candidates and biologic compounds that inhibit the activity of such cancer target for the treatment of cancer, and potentially other indications; and WHEREAS, Sanofi desires to acquire from RevMed, and RevMed desires to grant to Sanofi, certain licenses with regard to SHP2 Inhibitors and Products (as defined below), as further described herein.

1.12 "Control Shift" denotes, in reference to a Party:

(a) Any direct or indirect acquisition by one or more Third Parties, through a single transaction or a series of related transactions, of units and/or shares representing over 50% of the aggregate voting power at a general meeting for the election of directors or managers, held by the issued and outstanding units of equity of such Party (or any Affiliate that directly or indirectly controls said Party, herein referred to as the "Controlling Entity"), irrespective of the method of acquisition — be it via purchase, exchange, transfer, issuance, merger, or other means.

(b) A merger or consolidation under Applicable Law involving such Party or the Controlling Entity with a Third Party, except in cases where the units and/or shares of equity held by the Party or the Controlling Entity prior to the merger or consolidation continue to represent, or are converted into or exchanged for units and/or shares that represent, 50% or more of the aggregate voting power of the surviving or resulting entity or a parent entity of such surviving or resulting entity.

(c) The sale, lease, transfer, exclusive licensing, or other disposal of all or substantially all assets of such Party or the Controlling Entity to one or more Third Parties, as part of a single transaction or series of related transactions.

Notwithstanding the above, a financing transaction aimed at raising working capital for the relevant entity (RevMed) or acquiring assets from a Third Party will not be considered a "Control Shift," even if the Third Parties involved negotiate or receive their rights as security holders in such transactions; provided that no Change of Control results in any Major Biopharmaceutical Company holding over 50% of the aggregate voting power within RevMed, its Controlling Entity, or any subsequent surviving or resulting entity. The Controlling Entity of a Party, for the purposes of this Section 1.12, excludes any Excluded Investor; however, the applicable Shift in Control, merger, or asset transfer will not be exempt if it leads to any Major Biopharmaceutical Company holding over 50% of the aggregate voting power within RevMed, its Controlling Entity, or any surviving or resulting entity or a parent entity of such surviving or resulting entity.
